MCRunTimeProcessor.cc

00001 #include <string>
00002 #include <sstream>
00003 #include <stdexcept>
00004 
00005 #include "MCRunTimeProcessor.hh"
00006 #include "DBInitString.hh"
00007 #include "IMPL/LCEventImpl.h"
00008 
00009 // seconds to nano seconds
00010 #define NPS 1000000000LL
00011 
00012 using namespace std;
00013 
00014 namespace marlin {
00015 
00016   MCRunTimeProcessor aMCRunTimeProcessor;
00017   
00018   MCRunTimeProcessor::MCRunTimeProcessor() : Processor("MCRunTimeProcessor"),
00019                                              _runlocationwhizard( NULL ),
00020                                              _runtimewhizard( NULL ) {
00021     
00022     _description = "Sets the event time to the time of the given run number" ;
00023     
00024     registerProcessorParameter( "DBInit" ,
00025                                 "initialisation of the database" ,
00026                                 _dbInit,
00027                                 DBInitString() );
00028      
00029     /* Folder to be searched for the runtime information. 
00030      *
00031      * Fixme: we need to make sure that the folders we select here correspond
00032      * to the run we have at hand
00033      *
00034      */
00035     registerProcessorParameter( "RunTimeFolder",
00036                                 "Collection from DB which contains the start "
00037                                 "and stop time of a given run" ,
00038                                 _folderRunTime,
00039                                 string("/cd_calice/CALDAQ_RunTimeInfo"));
00040         
00041     /* Folder to be searched for the runlocation information. 
00042      *
00043      * Fixme: we need to make sure that the folders we select here correspond to
00044      * the run we have at hand
00045      *
00046      */
00047     registerProcessorParameter( "RunLocationFolder",
00048                                 "Collection from DB which contains information "
00049                                 "about the location of a run" ,
00050                                 _folderLocation,
00051                                 string("/cd_calice/RunLocation"));
00052     
00053     registerProcessorParameter( "RunNumber" , 
00054                                 "Run number of the run for MC files",
00055                                 _runNumber,
00056                                 int(230101)) ;
00057 
00058     registerProcessorParameter( "SavetyMargin", 
00059                                 "Apply a savety margin of n seconds between the "
00060                                 "nominal run start and the first MC event "
00061                                 "time stamp to ensure validity of conditions "
00062                                 "data", 
00063                                 _savetyMargin, 
00064                                 int(0));
00065   }
00066 
00067 
00068   MCRunTimeProcessor::~MCRunTimeProcessor() {
00069     if ( _runtimewhizard != NULL ) delete _runtimewhizard;
00070     if ( _runlocationwhizard != NULL ) delete _runlocationwhizard;
00071   }
00072 
00073   
00074   void MCRunTimeProcessor::init() {
00075     
00076     printParameters();
00077 
00078     // Initialize the whizards
00079     _runtimewhizard = new RunTimeWhizard(_folderRunTime, _dbInit);    
00080     _runlocationwhizard = new RunLocationWhizard(_folderLocation, _dbInit);
00081 
00082     /* Print some information like:
00083      *
00084      *   Runnumber: 350118
00085      *   Taken at: Cern
00086      *   of type: cernhcal
00087      *   on: 07/07
00088      */
00089     _runlocationwhizard->print(_runNumber, cout);
00090 
00091     // Get the start und stop time according to the run number
00092     LCTime starttime(_runtimewhizard->getRunStartTime(_runNumber));
00093     LCTime stoptime(_runtimewhizard->getRunStopTime(_runNumber));
00094     
00095     // Print the gathered time information
00096     streamlog_out(MESSAGE) << "Start time of run " << _runNumber << " is: " 
00097                            << starttime.getDateString() << endl
00098                            << "Stop time of run " << _runNumber << " is: " 
00099                            << stoptime.getDateString() << endl;
00100 
00101     // Check if the given run is shorter than the savety margin
00102     if (stoptime.timeStamp() - starttime.timeStamp() > _savetyMargin*NPS)
00103       _eventTime=LCTime(starttime.timeStamp()+_savetyMargin*NPS);
00104     else {
00105       stringstream message;
00106       message << " Run shorter than given savety margin of " 
00107               << _savetyMargin << " seconds." << endl;
00108       throw runtime_error(message.str()); 
00109     }   
00110   }
00111 
00112   void MCRunTimeProcessor::modifyEvent( LCEvent* evt ) {
00113 
00114     // Increase the next event time by one nano second
00115     _eventTime = LCTime(_eventTime.timeStamp() + 1);
00116     
00117     // Modify the run number and the time stamp of each event
00118     static_cast<LCEventImpl*>(evt)->setRunNumber(_runNumber);;
00119     static_cast<LCEventImpl*>(evt)->setTimeStamp(_eventTime.timeStamp());
00120 
00121   }    
00122

00124   void MCRunTimeProcessor::processRunHeader( LCRunHeader* run) {
00125   }

00128   void MCRunTimeProcessor::check( LCEvent* evt ) {
00129   }

00131   // Not needed  
00132   void MCRunTimeProcessor::end() {
00133   }
